summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Fourth Avenue North, from Hayes Street to Newton Street; Newton Street, from Fourth Avenue North to Fifth Avenue North, and Fifth Avenue North and East Queen Anne Drive, from Newton Street to Hayes Street, all in the City of Seattle, by constructing therein a sewer of proper dimensions and material, together with all necessary catch basins, manholes and other appurtenances necessary for the proper sewerage and drainage of said district, in accordance with Resolution No. 268 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899.
